Key Arguments: The legislation interferes with High Court–established freedoms of political communication.
The voluntary code has been used to suppress factually correct information.
The legislation is designed to censor public discourse and remove government accountability.
Penalties for digital platforms will harm businesses that facilitate communication.
Main Themes: Freedom of speech and political communication
Impact on businesses and digital platforms
Notable Quotes: The Misinformation Bill will harm Australians’ freedom of political communication.
It will further facilitate the suppression of government criticism.
Expanding the application of the code and the power of its enforcers will create an Orwellian situation where truth is defined by government policy.
